title: Ticket #7474: daemons other than the condor_master should not default to background
description:
Daemons other than the condor_master should not fork themselves into the background unless they are passed the -b flag.

Currently all HTCondor daemons assume background mode unless they are passed the -f flag, but this behavior only makes sense for the condor_master.

Daemon-core should be changed so that it defaults to foreground mode in the absence of any flag, and it should have a function that a dameon can call at the top of main that changes the default to background. Only the condor_master will call this function.

The motivating reason for this change is that it allows for a configuration only way to valgrind or strace a daemon. With the current code, the automatic inclusion of -f before <daemon>_ARGS makes a wrapper script necessary to valgrind or strace a daemon, but if we no longer automatically pass -f to child daemons, a wrapper script will no longer be necessary.
